Method Detail

isInterestedIn

public boolean isInterestedIn(MTInputEvent inputEvt)
Description copied from class: AbstractComponentProcessor
Checks if this input processor is interested in the specified MTInputEvent instance. If we want to create custom input processors we override this method and return true only for the kind of events we want to recieve.

Specified by:
isInterestedIn in class AbstractComponentProcessor
Parameters:
inputEvt - the input evt
Returns:
true, if is interested in

getCurrentComponentCursors

public java.util.List<InputCursor> getCurrentComponentCursors()
Gets all active cursors which started on this component. It is not check whether this input processor could lock any of them. User getAvailableComponentCursors() instead for that.

Returns:
the active component cursors

getFarthestFreeComponentCursorTo

public InputCursor getFarthestFreeComponentCursorTo(InputCursor cursor)
Returns the most far away component cursor to the specified cursor. Only returns a cursor if it is free to use and could be locked by this processor.

Parameters:
cursor - the cursor
Returns:
the farthest free component cursor to

canLock

protected boolean canLock(InputCursor... cursors)
Checks if this input processor would have the sufficient priority to lock the specified input cursors.

Parameters:
cursors - the cursors
Returns:
true, if successful

getLock

protected boolean getLock(InputCursor... cursors)
Locks the cursor with this processor if the processors lock priority is higher or equal than the current lock priority of this cursor.

Parameters:
cursors - the cursors
Returns:
true, if all specified cursors could get locked

unLock

protected void unLock(InputCursor... cursors)
Unlocks the specified cursors if they are not longer used by this processor. If the priority by which the cursors are locked changes by that, the cursorUnlocked method is invoked on processors with a lower priority who by that get a chance to lock this cursor again.

Parameters:
cursors - the cursors

compareTo

public int compareTo(AbstractComponentProcessor o)
Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<AbstractComponentProcessor>
Overrides:
compareTo in class AbstractComponentProcessor

cursorLocked

public abstract void cursorLocked(InputCursor cursor,
                                  IInputProcessor lockingprocessor)
This method is called if a input processor with a higher locking-priority than this one sucessfully locked the specified cursor. If this cursor was used in this input processor, we have to stop using it until it is unlocked by the other processor!

Parameters:
cursor - the cursor
lockingprocessor - the locking processor

cursorUnlocked

public abstract void cursorUnlocked(InputCursor cursor)
This method is called if a input processor with a higher locking-priority than this one removes his lock on the specified cursor (i.e. because the conditions for continuing the gesture aren't met anymore). This gives this input processor the chance to see if it can use the cursor and try to lock it again.

Parameters:
cursor - the cursor

                                   MTFingerInputEvt currentEvent)

inputCursor -
